etymology.description: semantic 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + phonetic 丩(丩) (jiū, "twist") = sound produced by mouth -> call; shout
etymology.interpretation: The character 叫(叫) (jiào, "call; shout") combines 口(口), representing a mouth making sounds, with 丩(丩), a phonetic element. This reflects the act of shouting or calling, which involves using the mouth.

examples.chinese: 妈妈叫我吃饭(媽媽叫我吃飯)。
他叫朋友快来(他叫朋友快來)，以免错过盛会(以免錯過盛會)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jiào péngyǒu kuài lái, yǐmiǎn cuòguò shènghuì。
examples.english: He calls his friend to come quickly, so as not to miss the grand event.

examples.chinese: 校长叫学生认真听讲(校長叫學生認真聽講)。
examples.english: The principal calls the students to listen attentively.
